job_title: Intern ‚Äì Geology Greenfields Exploration - North America
job_description: Website: www.anglogoldashanti.com SUMMARY / OBJECTIVE OF ROLE The US Greenfields Exploration (GFX) intern will be responsible for supporting the Greenfields Exploration team on projects that may include developing early-stage exploration projects though geologic investigation, leveraging GIS and 3-D modeling software, assisting drill program operations, and writing procedures and guidelines. Role Accountabilities: Aid the geology team in the execution of exploration activities including assisting with geologic mapping, surface sampling, drill program management, soil sampling, document management, and digital workspace organization. Use ArcGIS and LeapFrog Geo software to create, manipulate, and validate 2D and 3D data in support of GIS, and other spatial data projects for our US Exploration operations. Example data types include geologic mapping, satellite imagery, drilling, geochemical samples, land boundaries, etc. Assist with data management, digitization, and organization. Assist the Senior Geologist in side projects supporting the overall exploration workflow. Technical Competencies: Basic understanding of exploration techniques, including mapping and sampling. Experience in GIS and modeling software platforms (ESRI ArcGIS and Leapfrog Geo). Must be able to: crawl, crouch, kneel, sit, climb, walk, stoop, and stand frequently. work outside for extended periods in extreme temperatures. walk on uneven terrain and slopes for an extended period. lift to 50 pounds at times. Near vision must be sufficient to read, without strain, printed material the size of typewritten character. Normal depth perception and field of vision are required, as is the ability to distinguish basic colors. Must be able to legally drive company vehicles if assigned. Will be required to wear Personal Protective Equipment, including steel toed boots, high-visibility clothing, protective eyewear, and hearing protection. Leadership & Management Competencies: Preforms activities with limited supervision while remaining within agreed boundaries of activities, methodologies, and company policies & procedures. Fosters a positive team environment and able to collaborate well with others. Detailed organizational, planning, and analytical skills. EDUCATION & QUALIFICATIONS: Undergraduate or graduate degree in Geology. GENERAL KNOWLEDGE & EXPERIENCE: Strong awareness and commitment to safety in the workplace and at the project site. In the process of completing a degree in Geology. Problem-solving skills Be self-motivated; have an ‚Äúinvestigative / curious‚Äù nature; and be driven to help the entire organization successfully achieve its goals Excellent verbal and written communication skills- listening, reasoning, speaking, and presenting COMPENSATION: Undergraduate: $27/hour Graduate: $35/hour AngloGold Ashanti Limited Reg No: 1944/017354/06 EQUAL OPPORTUNITY STATEMENT AngloGold Ashanti North America Inc. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type with regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Overview


Keysight is at the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~15,000 employees create world-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Learn more about what we do.

 

Our award-winning culture embraces a bold vision of where technology can take us and a passion for tackling challenging problems with industry-first solutions. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers.


Responsibilities


We are looking for a passionate and energetic intern to undertake real-world commercial challenges of platform software development. You will be working on software running on various hardware, VM or cloud solutions offered by Keysight. Ideal candidate is an CS or CE major with very strong CS background.


Qualifications


 

Current students pursuing BS/MS/PhD in CS/CE with strong background in software development.
  • Strong programming experience focused on Linux development environments.
  • Proficiency in object-oriented analysis, design & programming.
  • Advanced programming skills using language such as golang, Python, C++, and/or Java.
  • Effective teamwork and communication skills.
  • Experience in Cloud technologies (Docker, Kubernetes etc) strongly preferred.
  • Experience in Linux technologies (kernel, network-manager, systemd etc) considered a huge plus.
Candidates who wish to be considered must be enrolled in a accredited college/university as of September 2026. Applicants who have graduated before September 2026 will not be considered unless they are entering/applying to a MS or PHD program after graduating.

 

Visa Sponsorship is not available for this position. Candidates who now or at any point in the future require sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H-1B Visa status) may not be considered.

 

Keysight Technologies Inc. is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other protected categories under all applicable laws.

 

The level of role will be based on applicable experience, education and skills; Most offers will be between the minimum and the midpoint of the Salary Range listed below.

 

California pay range: MIN $40.32-$43.49/hour

 

Note: For other locations, pay ranges will vary by region.

 

Careers Privacy Statement***Keysight is an Equal Opportunity Employer.***

Are you fascinated by machine learning, data science, and the challenge of scaling models across complex environments? As our Architecture & Innovation Intern, you‚Äôll dive into a forward‚Äëlooking initiative: expanding our claim complexity model beyond Maine and helping to determine how it should evolve as we introduce additional states. You‚Äôll explore real‚Äëworld questions that don‚Äôt have straightforward answers. This is hands‚Äëon, high‚Äëimpact work where your analysis and recommendations will directly help influence decisions. What You‚Äôll Work On You‚Äôll start by digging into the existing claim complexity model and understanding how it functions today. From there, you‚Äôll explore what it would take to expand the model to additional states ‚Äî including evaluating whether a unified model or multiple state‚Äëbased models is the best approach. Your work will involve: Conducting exploratory data analysis to understand differences across states Evaluating feature availability, regulatory considerations, and data consistency Assessing historical data volume and how it impacts model performance Comparing machine learning models and determining whether the current approach still fits Engineering features, defining labels, and performing statistical analysis Writing scripts to generate reports and insights Supporting documentation, research, and model‚Äërelated tasks Participating in meetings, updating scrum boards, and collaborating with the broader Architecture & Innovation team Potentially working with AWS, pipelines, testing, and source control Your findings will help shape MEMIC‚Äôs long‚Äëterm modeling strategy ‚Äî and you‚Äôll gain experience with real machine learning challenges that go far beyond classroom examples. What You Bring Pursuing an Associate‚Äôs degree or higher Experience with Python, Jupyter Notebooks, Data Visualization and SQL Why You‚Äôll Love This Internship You won‚Äôt just be running models ‚Äî you‚Äôll be helping decide how MEMIC should scale them. You‚Äôll work on meaningful, open‚Äëended problems that require creativity, technical skill, and strategic thinking. ___________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ MEMIC is committed to a policy of nondiscrimination and equal opportunity for all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religious creed, national origin, ancestry, age, disability, genetics, gender identity, veteran's status, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law. Why Join our Tax Technology Team as an Intern? At Grant Thornton, our Tax Technology team works with large, complex organizations to improve how tax departments operate by implementing scalable technology solutions and driving meaningful process improvements. Our work spans a range of areas, including the design, configuration, and integration of tax engines for both direct and indirect taxes. We help clients automate and streamline calculation, compliance, and reporting activities, building long-term efficiency and accuracy into their operations. Beyond tax engines, we work with a variety of modern platforms outside of traditional tax software. This includes enterprise systems, data automation tools, workflow tracking solutions, and visualization platforms. We support clients in streamlining data collection, implementing workflow automation, enhancing tax data management, and integrating emerging technologies like AI to solve complex tax challenges. Cambridge Associates delivers a range of services, including outsourced CIO, non-discretionary portfolio management, and investment consulting.Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, CA has offices in key markets in North America, the United Kingdom, Europe, Asia, and Oceania. ¬†Our worldwide teams ensure our clients benefit from decades of global presence, local expertise, and relationships with the top global investment managers across the world. ¬†For more information, please visit www.cambridgeassociates.com.Job Description Summary:THE OPPORTUNITYData Analyst Internship ProgramPOSITION SPECIFICSLocation of Position: Boston, MAProgram Length: 10-week program from early June to mid-August (open to rising juniors and seniors: Class of 2026 &2027)Required for Application: ResumeOffice Requirement: Intern is expected to work in their assigned office at least 4 days per week with the option to work from home 1 day per weekExpected Hours: Interns are expected to work 40 hours per weekBase Pay/Salary: Boston, MA: $25 / hour and additionally, offer includes sign-on bonus.Job Description:DATA ANALYST INTERNSHIP PROGRAMThe Data Office at Cambridge Associates is seeking motivated and curious interns to join our team for a 10-week summer program. This is an exciting opportunity to gain hands-on financial services domain knowledge and experience in business and data analysis, data governance, data engineering, and development work that supports our enterprise data initiatives. Interns will work closely with the Chief Data Officer and Data Office team on projects that drive data governance, data quality, master data management (Security Master), and the development of our Snowflake Data Platform.You will be exposed to real-world challenges in data management, analytics, and technology, and will contribute to projects that have a meaningful impact on our organization‚Äôs data strategy. This program is designed for students who are eager to learn, collaborate, and develop foundational skills for a career in data and analytics.Responsibilities:Collaborate with Data Office professionals on projects related to business analysis, data governance, data engineering, and development.Support the development and enhancement of the Data Platform, including data integration and automation tasks.Assist in the business and data analysis, design, testing, and implementation of data quality and master data management solutions.Analyze and document business and data requirements for data-related initiatives.Participate in data profiling, data cleansing, and data validation activities.Contribute to the creation of dashboards, reports, and data visualizations to support decision-making.Engage in team meetings, planning sessions, and code reviews.Communicate findings and progress clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Take part in self-guided learning and training sessions to build technical and business knowledge.We Offer:Mentorship from experienced Data Office professionals and the Chief Data Officer.Exposure to enterprise-level data management, governance, and engineering practices.Networking opportunities with leaders across the organization and with other interns.Participation in intern-specific events, employee resource groups, and service council activities.Access to online learning platforms and resources for self-directed skill development.A collaborative, inclusive, and supportive work field.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with passion solving complex problems through dataInterest in data management, data engineering, or business analysis.Basic programming experience Firm Overview:Cambridge Associates (‚ÄúCA‚Äù) is a leading global investment firm. CA‚Äôs goal is to help endowments & foundations, pension plans, and ultra-high net worth private clients implement and manage custom investment portfolios that generate outperformance so that they can maximize their impact on the world. Cambridge Associates delivers a range of services, including outsourced CIO, non-discretionary portfolio management, and investment consulting.Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, CA has offices in key markets in North America, the United Kingdom, Europe, Asia, and Oceania. ¬†Our worldwide teams ensure our clients benefit from decades of global presence, local expertise, and relationships with the top global investment managers across the world. ¬†For more information, please visit www.cambridgeassociates.com.Job Description Summary:THE TEAMThe Digital Engagement Team at CA partners with business stakeholders to deliver technology solutions that build relationships among employees and clients, accelerates product and service adoption, and supports business process change in order to enable business growth and development. To do so, the team is committed to designing and implementing digital and non-digital methods that enhance employee and client online experiences in three areas: Employee Engagement (DEX), Customer Relationship Management (CRM), and Digital Client Experience (DCX). More specifically, the Employee Engagement area centers around software and processes that enhance productivity and collaboration through digital community, digital strategy (external websites, digital marketing, and social media), measuring and monitoring employee engagement, and knowledge management. Our primary software stack includes Igloo Software, Box, Asana, Canva, and Microsoft products. The team is focused on delivering value for our colleagues by handling the technical aspects such as prioritizing integrations with other applications in the enterprise, creating analytics dashboards, providing concierge support for each solution, and managing vendor relationships. We also provide project-specific support for new vendor analysis, website updates, communications campaigns, and software releases.THE OPPORTUNITYCambridge Associates (CA) is looking for a Summer Intern for its IT Digital Engagement department located in Boston, MA, or Arlington, VA. Candidate must be actively enrolled in an undergraduate program at an accredited College or University or have an equivalent work background. Under the supervision of our staff, the candidate can expect to participate in projects centering around the technical management of software-as-a-service (SaaS) platforms focused on improving how our employees work together. The Summer Intern on the Digital Engagement team will play a key role in helping to implement technology solutions for Employee Engagement that build and strengthen CA‚Äôs employee community, measure and build programs that increase employee belonging, and enable best-in-class collaboration practices for a hybrid workforce. By liaising with the Corporate Communications Team, Human Capital Team, and the Client Relationship Management (CRM) Team, this individual will work with stakeholders to monitor, update, and promote new technology and enhancements into current and new business processes. Interns are expected to work 40 hours per week during the summer (June-August). Interns will be competitively compensated. The individual is expected to be onsite 1 or 2 days each week in the Boston, MA, or Arlington, VA, office. Most work will be completed independently and remotely over Microsoft Teams or Zoom.Interns will gain knowledge of how an Information Technology Department supports a financial services firm by working on projects with analysts and developers from a variety of IT teams.Job Description:RESPONSIBILITIESA successful candidate will interact with employees as they set up blogs and websites, complete light graphic design, in Canva, and complete data and analysis projects using PowerBi for our core software offerings. The candidate will also work alongside our team on AI integration projects and will have access to SaaS vendors to explore the process of software updates, contract renewals, and other related technical elements. They must have the willingness to engage in ad hoc projects and initiatives as they are identified, some of which will be tailored to the interests of the candidate, especially in business intelligence and data visualization.QUALIFICATIONSCandidate must be actively enrolled in an undergraduate program at an accredited College or University¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Demonstrated interest or experience in PowerBI, business intelligence, or data visualization toolsDemonstrated ability to communicate in both verbal and written communication in formal and informal contexts designed to build consensus¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Ability to present work in a clear and concise manner, including data-driven insights¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Ability to set and meet deadlines autonomously¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Strong organizational management skills and ability to manage multiple projects at one time¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Proactive problem solver who is eager to learn and contribute, especially in the areas of business intelligence and analyticsBase salary range for this role:Pay Range Minimum:0Pay Range Maximum:0In addition to the listed salary range, this position is eligible for an annual performance-based bonus and a comprehensive, competitive benefits package.
